title: Venetian Isles, New Orleans
text:
Venetian Isles () is a <a href="neighborhood">neighborhood</a> of <a href="New%20Orleans%2C%20Louisiana">New Orleans, Louisiana</a>. It is located on the western shore of the <a href="Chef%20Menteur%20Pass">Chef Menteur Pass</a> on the northern side of <a href="U.S.%20Route%2090">U.S. Highway 90</a>.
Legally a part of the <a href="city">city</a>, Venetian Isles is separated from the bulk of the developed portion of the city by miles of undeveloped land. It long had the appearance of a small <a href="fishing%20town">fishing town</a>. In the late 20th century it saw development as a <a href="suburb">suburb</a>an style <a href="bedroom%20community">bedroom community</a>.
The ruins of old <a href="Fort%20Macomb">Fort Macomb</a> are along <a href="Chef%20Menteur%20Pass">Chef Menteur Pass</a> at the south of the neighborhood.
Venetian Isles was hit hard by <a href="storm%20surge">storm surge</a> during <a href="Hurricane%20Katrina">Hurricane Katrina</a> in 2005. As it lies outside of the City's levee system, it experienced damage similar to that seen in <a href="Pearlington%2C%20Mississippi">Pearlington, Mississippi</a> and <a href="Pass%20Christian">Pass Christian</a>.
Former <a href="Louisiana%27s%202nd%20congressional%20district">2nd District</a> Congressman <a href="Joseph%20Cao">Joseph Cao</a> makes his home in Venetian Isles.
